Dear Ms Schultz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed
on September 28-October 5, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are
also violations of the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license license will be
issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will
result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child's record, within 7
calendar days after placement, the information specified in
R 400.12417(1) and all of the following information:
(g) Documentation of the child's placement preparation.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. Four out of eight files did
not have placement preparation documented.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(e) Replacement preparation, regardless of the child's
age, appropriate to the child's capacity to understand,
which includes an explanation to all relevant parties as to
why the change is necessary.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One out of eight files did
not have replacement preparation documented in the file.
REPEAT VIOLATION-2019 INTERIM
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(g) Information about the child was shared with the new
placement, consistent with the requirements of R
400.12417.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. Two out of eight files did
not have information about the child shared at replacement.
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement
of a child:
4

(b) Child's date of birth.
(c) Available known information about the child’s health.
(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
(e) All known emotional and psychological factors relating
to the care of the child.
(f) All known behaviors of the child.
(g) Circumstances necessitating placement or replacement
of the child.
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent
to provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the
foster child and the foster family, including information
about siblings who do not reside in the foster home.
(i) Name of assigned social service worker.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. Two out of eight files did
not provide the above information to the foster parent before or
upon placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION-2019 INTERIM
(j) Authorization to provide routine and emergency medical
care.
Three out of eight files did not provide the foster parent with
authorization for medical care before or upon placement of the
foster child.
REPEAT VIOLATION-2019 INTERIM

R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the
family signing an adoption application and prior to
approving a family for adoption.
Three adoption applicants were reviewed. One out of three
applicants did not have an evaluation completed within 90 days
of the application date. The application was signed on 1/29/20
and the evaluation was completed on 6/24/20.

R 400.12606 Training requirements.
An agency shall document that an applicant for adoption
has, at a minimum, had training in all of the following areas:
(a) Separation.
(b) Attachment and bonding.
(c) Child development, including safe sleep practices for
children under 1 year of age.
(d) Behavioral and emotional needs of adoptive children.

(e) Impact of adoption on the family.
(f) Post adoption service availability.
Three adoption applicants were reviewed. Three out of three
applicants did not have training as outlined above.
